pullRequest.body:
In this PR, given a functor `F : C â¥¤ H`, and `L : C â¥¤ D` that is a localization functor for `W : MorphismProperty C`, we define `F.totalRightDerived L W : D â¥¤ H` as the left Kan extension of `F` along `L`: it is defined if the type class `F.HasRightDerivedFunctor W` asserting the existence of a left Kan extension is satisfied.

---

- [x] depends on: #12785

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12785~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!

Do we have left derived functors yet?
Thanks JoÃ«l and Dagur
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.
How does this mesh with `Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Abelian/RightDerived.lean`?

> How does this mesh with `Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Abelian/RightDerived.lean`?

Eventually, `Abelian.RightDerived` will be refactored (as in my draft branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/jriou_localization/Mathlib/Algebra/Homology/DerivedCategory/RightDerivedFunctorPlus.lean#L207 ), but we need more material: derived categories, the injective derivability structure, existence of derived functors from derivability structures, etc.

> Do we have left derived functors yet?

No, but I would rather develop the right side more before dualising the results.

> > How does this mesh with `Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Abelian/RightDerived.lean`?
> 
> Eventually, `Abelian.RightDerived` will be refactored (as in my draft branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/jriou_localization/Mathlib/Algebra/Homology/DerivedCategory/RightDerivedFunctorPlus.lean#L207 ), but we need more material: derived categories, the injective derivability structure, existence of derived functors from derivability structures, etc.

@joelriou could you please explain this in a comment in both files? Then people can be aware of the dual development of the theory for the time being.

> @joelriou could you please explain this in a comment in both files? Then people can be aware of the dual development of the theory for the time being.

Thanks for the suggestion. I have just added TODO in the relevant files.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9384386739/job/25840066506)

```suggestion Î±.app X â‰« (rightDerivedNatTrans RF RF' Î± Î±' W Ï„).app (L.obj X) = ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rightDerivedNatTrans RF RF' Î± Î±' W Ï„ â‰« rightDerivedNatTrans RF' RF'' Î±' Î±'' W Ï„' = ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rightDerivedNatTrans RF RF' Î± Î±' W Ï„ â‰« rightDerivedNatTrans RF' RF'' Î±' Î±'' W Ï„' = ```
Do you plan to redefine the abelian version using `totalRightDerived`? Maybe add a todo?

Of course, I plan to do this! (Actually, I already have all the code doing this, but it may take a certain time to PR all of this.) The TODO is added in another PR about derivability structures https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12633/files#diff-361ff4332cd7e3dd7ca507d30f04b09322dcb207f3f5891c4811b79f850f5c7b

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories

> How does this mesh with `Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Abelian/RightDerived.lean`?

Eventually, `Abelian.RightDerived` will be refactored (as in my draft branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/jriou_localization/Mathlib/Algebra/Homology/DerivedCategory/RightDerivedFunctorPlus.lean#L207 ), but we need more material: derived categories, the injective derivability structure, existence of derived functors from derivability structures, etc.

No, but I would rather develop the right side more before dualising the results.
